Security measures: On 9 May 2020, Aydin Governorship announced a mandatory use of face masks in all the public spaces in the province as part of the efforts against coronavirus outbreak.

On 8 May 2020, families who claim their children have been kidnapped by the PKK continued their sit-in protest in front of the HDP provincial building in Diyarbakir city center for the 249th day. The families accused HDP of working with PKK, and demanded their children be returned.

Security measures: On 8 May 2020, Beyoglu Governorship announced a mandatory use of face masks and at least 3 meters social distancing rule as part of the efforts against coronavirus outbreak effective in Istiklal street and Taksim square, which are the most touristic areas of Istanbul with around 2 million visitors daily.

Security measures: On 8 May 2020, Van Governor's Office extended the duration of the ban on all forms of marches, protests, press conferences, sit-ins and other political actions for another 15 days, effective until May 23.

assoc_actor_1: TJA: Free Women's Movement; Women (Turkey); HDP: Peoples Democratic Party
notes: On 8 May 2020, TJA activists and HDP organized a protest outside HDP building in central Van, demanding the release of political prisoners during the coronavirus outbreak.

On 8 May 2020, around 500 local residents of Basakpinar neighborhood of Talas, Kayseri held a demonstration against the burial of the body of Ibrahim Gokcek in their local cemetery upon the body's arrival from Istanbul. Gokcek was a member of the leftist music band 'Group Yorum', who lost her life the day before due to the hunger strike he had been holding to protest the terrorism charges against the band and demand fair trial. The residents said they will not accept the burial of Gokcek in their town.

On 8 May 2020, a group of high school students held a demonstration outside the district administration of the ministry of national education in Kadikoy, Istanbul, in protest of the decision changing the second time the date of university entrance exams which will be participated by around 2.5 million students. A few weeks ago, the organization had announced the postponement of the nation-wide university entrance exams to 25-26 July amid the lockdowns and other security measures against coronavirus, but then changed the date one more time to 27-28 June.

source: Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; Bianet; Demokrat Haber; Karar
notes: On 8 May 2020, a demonstration was organized in Gazi Cemevi (worship place of Alevis) in Sultangazi, Istanbul during the funeral ceremony of Ibrahim Gokcek, a member of the leftist music band 'Group Yorum', and lost his life the day before due to the hunger strike he had been holding to protest the terrorism charges against the band and demand fair trial. The police did not allow the group to hold a demonstration, dispersed and detained 18 participants.

On 8 May 2020, 18 people who had been detained by the police during their demonstration at the funeral of Ibrahim Gokcek were reportedly tortured at the headquarters of Istanbul police organization in central Istanbul. The detainees had reportedly bruises, scrapes and other signs of physical violence on various parts of their bodies. One detainee was subject to strangulation, and had difficulty during speaking with his lawyer as a result. Ibrahim Gokcek was a member of the leftist music band 'Group Yorum', and lost his life the day before due to the hunger strike he had been holding to protest the terrorism charges against the band and demand fair trial.
Property destruction: On 8 May 2020, HBDH militants carried out an arson attack targeting a hotel building in Adrasan village of Kumluca. The attack caused material damage in the hotel.

On 8 May 2020, Martyr Rizgar Farqin Vengeance Units attacked police officers in Yeni neighborhood of Ipekyolu, Diyarbakir by throwing improvised explosives. The source reported several police injuries, but did not specify the number.

On 8 May 2020, a group of environmentalists and local residents held a demonstration in Carsamba, Samsun outside a biomass energy plant to protest the environmentally harmful activities of the facility which remained open despite the court rule enforcing it to shut down.
On 8 May 2020, YPS militants carried out an attack targeting Surici police station in Sur town, Diyarbakir by throwing improvised explosives. No information on casualties was reported by source.

Total 6 Turkish soldiers were reportedly killed  (PKK's claim of fatalities among Turkish forces is coded as 0 fatalities).

notes: On 1 May 2020, union confederations, political parties and NGO representatives held demonstrations at Taksim square, Beyoglu, Istanbul on the occasion of International Workers' Day, which was allowed exceptionally during the nation-wide curfew that is in effect as part of the measures against coronavirus outbreak. Among the participants were CHP and HDP MPs and executives, TURK-IS, HAK-IS, DISK, KESK, TMMOB, TTB members and executives, as well as the representatives of many other small unions. Participants were allowed to visit Kazanci Yokusu street and the republic monument in small groups, where they leave their wreaths and read their press statements only if they respect social distancing rules. Police intervened as DISK members decided to march to the demonstration area as a crowded group contrary to police order to reach there by bus with a small group of representatives. 25 DISK members and executives were detained.

On 1 May 2020, a group gathered and held a demonstrative march in Kadikoy town, Istanbul to mark the International Workers' Day despite the nation-wide curfew that is in effect as part of the measures against coronavirus outbreak. Police dispersed the group and detained 11 protesters.

The police did not allow the group to march to the Cemevi (the worship place of Alevis) to hold the religious ceremony, dispersed and detained many participants, including the driver of the funeral car and the family members of Bolek. The police only allowed the funeral to be taken directly to the Ferikoy cemetery for burial, did not allow more than a few family members to be present and used tear gas to disperse the crowd gathering around the cemetery.

Arrests: As reported on January 7, Coast Guard Command of Turkish Army detained 78 migrants who attempted to cross the border illegally by boats in an operation they carried out off the shore in Bodrum district, Mugla. The migrants were from Syria, Central African Republic, Egypt, Palestine, Somalia, Yemen, South Africa and Lebanon.
Arrests: As reported on January 7, 36 Afghan migrants who were on a bus en route to cross the border illegally to Greece were detained by Police in Suleymanpasa district of Tekirdag.

Arrests: As reported between Jan 5-8, a total 125 migrants attempting to cross the border illegally to Greece were detained by the operations of Police forces and Coast Guard Command of Turkish Army in Kusadasi district of Aydin. The migrants were from Afghanistan, Congo, Syria, Kuwait, Mali, Sierra Leone, Sudan, Somalia, Nigeria and Angola.

Arrests: As reported on January 7, 84 migrants who entered Turkey illegally were detained by the police forces in an abandoned building they were hiding in Ipekyolu town of Van. The nationalities of the migrants remain unknown.

On 7 January 2020, 63 families who claim their children have been kidnapped by the PKK continued their sit-in protest in front of the HDP provincial building in Diyarbakir city centre for the 127th day. The families accused HDP of working with the PKK, and demanded their children to be returned.

On 7 January 2020, Martyr Rizgar Derxust Vengeance Units of YPS attacked a patrolling police vehicle in Baglar, Diyarbakir by throwing improvised explosives. Material damage to the vehicle was reported.

assoc_actor_1: Health Workers (Turkey); SES: Trade Union of Employees in Public Health and Social Services

On 7 January 2020, 4 public workers who were dismissed by a government decree organised a protest event at Yuksel Street in Cankaya district of Ankara to demand their jobs back. Police intervened and detained 4 protesters.

Arrests: As reported on January 6, 31 migrants who entered Turkey illegally were detained by the gendarmerie forces on a minibus as they were travelling on a highway in Maden district of Elazig. The migrants were from India, Pakistan, Myanmar, Bangladesh and Afghanistan.

On 6 January 2020, a group of Istanbul Technical University students staged a protest outside the university's campus in Sariyer town, Istanbul against the decision that suspended 4 students who held a demonstration against the recent price hikes at the cafeteria.

On 6 January 2020, around 50 shuttle bus drivers held a protest outside the management building of the General Directorate of State Hydraulic Works in central Adana, claiming the contractor who won the organisation's staff transportation tender is not qualified to fulfil the service as their vehicles do not possess the necessary certification to carry people for commercial purposes. The protesters argued the result of the tender is illegal as it is based on unfair competition practices.
On 6 January 2020, a group of bikers gathered in the center of Kadikoy district, Istanbul to protest the alleged human right violations of China towards Uighurs in Xinjiang.

On 6 January 2020, 63 families who claim their children have been kidnapped by the PKK continued their sit-in protest in front of the HDP provincial building in Diyarbakir city centre for the 126th day. The families accused HDP of working with the PKK, and demanded their children to be returned.

On 6 January 2020, the time-share renters of a thermal resort held a protest outside the facility in Afyonkarahisar province, claiming they have to pay for the amenities and facilities who had been previously free of charge following the transfer of the resort's ownership. The renters urged the new management to honor the lease contracts which allegedly guarantee the use of facilities free of charge.

On 6 January 2020, HAVA-IS trade union which represents the aviation workers held a protest outside the Turkish Airlines' management building in Bakirkoy district, Istanbul, claiming the company does not respect the collective bargaining agreement signed with the union and ground service workers are forced to work overtime without pay.

As reported on January 6, a protest event was held at Yuksel Park in Kizilay, Ankara to express solidarity with a prisoner who went on hunger strike to demand fair trial. Police dispersed the group and detained 2 protesters.

On 6 January 2020, 4 public workers who were dismissed by a government decree organised a protest event at Yuksel Street in Cankaya district of Ankara to demand their jobs back. Police intervened and detained 4 protesters.

Arrests: As reported on January 5, Coast Guard Command of Turkish Army detained 42 migrants who attempted to cross the border illegally by boats in an operation they carried out off the shore in Karaburun district, Izmir. The migrants were from Somalia, Palestine and Libya.

Arrests: As reported on January 5, 41 Afghan migrants attempting to cross the border illegally to Greece were detained in an operation of Coast Guard Command of Turkish Army in Ayvalik district of Balikesir.

source: Human Rights Foundation of Turkey; Bianet
notes: On 5 January 2020, two people were physically assaulted / tortured by the police forces upon their detention in the Gazi police station in Sultangazi district, Istanbul. The victims reported that as soon as they arrived at the police station, they were thrown onto the floor as their hands were cuffed from the back. In that position, they were beaten for several hours by around 10 police officers who hit the victims in upper leg and kidney areas as well as on the backbone.

assoc_actor_1: The Martyr Baran Dersim Vengeance Units; Martyr Sakine Cansiz Vengeance Units

On 5 January 2020, a union representing high school students and the family members of 15-year old Berkin Elvan who was killed in Istanbul during the 2013 Gezi protests held a demonstration where Elvan was killed in Sisli in Istanbul, to demand justice for the case.
On 5 January 2020, around 500 Syrian protesters gathered in Antakya town center of Hatay province to condemn Syrian regime's airstrikes targeting Idlib city in Syria.

On 5 January 2020, 63 families who claim their children have been kidnapped by the PKK continued their sit-in protest in front of the HDP provincial building in Diyarbakir city centre for the 125th day. The families accused HDP of working with the PKK, and demanded their children to be returned.

On 5 January 2020, a protest event was held outside U.S consulate building in Sariyer district of Istanbul to condemn the killing of Qasem Soleimani, Iranian Major General in the Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps by an U.S attack in Iraq.

HPG reported that on January 5, PKK militants attacked Turkish soldiers near Aydinlar military outpost in Aralik district of Igdir. One soldier was reportedly killed  (PKK's claim of fatalities among Turkish forces is coded as 0 fatalities).

On 5 January 2020, 4 public workers who were dismissed by a government decree organised a protest event at Yuksel Street in Cankaya district of Ankara to demand their jobs back. Police intervened and detained 4 protesters.

On 4 January 2020, a group university students staged a protest in central Kadikoy, Istanbul upon a recent suicide case in which a university student killed herself allegedly due to the economical problems she had. Protesters claimed suicides of students have become more common due to bad economy.

On 4 January 2020, 135 mine workers who were dismissed by the company they worked continued their protests in Sorgun district of Yozgat to demand their jobs back and the pending payments of their last 2 month salaries.

On 4 January 2020, families who claim their children have been kidnapped by the PKK continued their sit-in protest in front of the HDP provincial building in Diyarbakir city centre for the 124th day. The families accused HDP of working with the PKK, and demanded their children to be returned.

On 3 January 2020, a group of university students continued their protests outside the directorate building of the Istanbul university in Fatih district against the university administration's decision to reduce the number of subsidized meal service at the university cafeteria from 3 times per day to once a day and also to remove the breakfast meal.

On 3 January 2020, a group of truck drivers working in the transport business blocked a road with their trucks in cenral Kutahya in protest against the enforced implementation of the 'Digital tachograph' devices in all the trucks. Protesters claim the deadline given for the implementation is not realistic, they lack the necessary information on the system as well as the necessary technical infrastructure.

On 3 January 2020, a group of parents whose children are enrolled in a private school group organised a protest event outside the building of the Istanbul Directorate of National Education in Fatih district of Istanbul, following the halting of the education due to pending salary payments of the teachers for last 14 months. Parents demanded the payment of the outstanding salaries to the teachers and a solution to be found for their childrens' halted education.
